title: Citi Pakistan Wins 'Best Community Program' at the Asian CSR Awards 2011
summary: Citi Pakistan has been awarded the Best Community Program Award for its initiative, 'Beyond Sustainability: Driving poverty alleviation through microfinance in Pakistan' in the Poverty Alleviation category of the Asian Corporate Social Responsibility Awards 2011, which were held in conjunction with Intel. Citi Pakistan was competing against 175 entries from 129 companies in 14 countries for this award.
tag-1: Citi Pakistan Wins 'Best Community Program' at the Asian CSR Awards 2011
tag-2: Citi Pakistan has been awarded the Best Community Program Award for its initiative, 'Beyond Sustainability: Driving poverty alleviation through microfinance in Pakistan' in the Poverty Alleviation category of the Asian Corporate Social Responsibility Awards 2011, which were held in conjunction with Intel. Citi Pakistan was competing against 175 entries from 129 companies in 14 countries for this award.
tag-3: "The project integrated solution using community skills and market need. It is building capacity and creating market. It is micro entrepreneurship rather than only microfinance. Businesses are sustainable even after funding pulled out. There are clear, measurable objectives and good process tools," said the judges who selected the award winners.
tag-4: Citi Pakistan's program was based on a Microfinance Village Tourism initiative, in partnership with the Thardeep Rural Development Program (TRDP), with a special emphasis on female entrepreneurship. The key objectives of the program focused on tackling issues of poverty, gender discrimination and unemployment. Most importantly, there was a focus on improving Pakistan's perception through increasing tourism in the region through microentrepreneurship initiatives. As a result of this program, 70 new businesses have been set up, and 15,000 lives have been impacted through an improved means of livelihood and reduction in environmental degradation.
tag-5: "We are humbled at being recognized for our responsible finance efforts in Pakistan at the 2011 Asian CSR Awards. We enjoy a longstanding partnership with TRDP and this particular initiative has helped us kick-start a number of new, small-scale businesses in the much neglected area of Tharparkar in Sindh," said Arif Usmani, Citi Country Officer for Pakistan. "We hope to sustain this program and continue contributing to long-term development in the region, with a particular emphasis on promoting female entrepreneurship."
tag-6: Citi Pakistan remains committed to efforts to advance the microfinance industry in the country. This is evidenced through their participation in the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards (CMA), supported by the Citi Foundation. Now in 28 countries, CMA illustrates and promotes the effective role that individual microentrepeneurs have made to the economic sustainability of their families as well as their communities.
tag-7: Citi Pakistan has focused its programs on microentrepreneurship for vulnerable groups, including helping women entrepreneurs set up businesses. This year also marks the completion of Citi's microfinance flood rehabilitation program with the Pakistan Poverty Alleviation Fund for enabling vulnerable groups (particularly disabled groups, widows and the ultra poor impacted by the floods last year) to regain their livelihoods.
